docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 -- The Foreign Economic Administration today announced a further move in its program to modify decentralization procedure, so far as exports to Latin America are concerned. Beginning Jan. 1, applications for licenses to export...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 -- The Foreign Economic Administration today announced a further move in its program to modify decentralization procedure, so far as exports to Latin America are concerned. Beginning Jan. 1, applications for licenses to export certain commodities to fifteen American republics need no longer be accompanied by import recommendations from officials of the country of destination.

headline.main: FEA EASES CONTROL OVER EXPORTS ANEW; Covers Number of Items for Shipment to Latin America -- Effective Jan. 1

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
